intro: Ainsliaea glabra var. sutchuenensis, commonly known as the Sichuan ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine pubescence. This variant is distinguished by its reduced leaf size and floral structure compared to the typical form of Ainsliaea glabra. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions of Sichuan Province.
